filmography.title: The Kid
filmography.role_description: A poor, lonely tramp who finds an abandoned baby and raises him as his own son.
filmography.plot: The Tramp cares for an abandoned child, but events put that relationship in jeopardy.

filmography.title: The Gold Rush
filmography.role_description: A lonely prospector who ventures into the Alaskan Klondike looking for gold and finds romance.
filmography.plot: A prospector goes to the Klondike in search of gold and finds it and more.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Sound (1942 re-release); National Film Registry (Inducted 1992)

filmography.title: The Circus
filmography.role_description: A tramp who accidentally becomes the star of a circus while fleeing from the police.
filmography.plot: The Tramp finds work and the girl of his dreams at a circus.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Honorary Award (Versatility and genius in acting, writing, directing and producing)

filmography.title: City Lights
filmography.role_description: A homeless tramp who falls in love with a beautiful blind flower girl and tries to help her medically.
filmography.plot: With the aid of a wealthy erratic drunkard, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.

filmography.title: Modern Times
filmography.role_description: A factory worker struggling to survive in the modern, industrialized world.
filmography.plot: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

filmography.title: The Great Dictator
filmography.role_description: A dual role: a ruthless fascist dictator and a gentle Jewish barber who looks exactly like him.
filmography.plot: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor, Best Picture, Best Writing; National Film Registry (Inducted 1997)

filmography.title: Monsieur Verdoux
filmography.role_description: A suave bank clerk who marries and murders wealthy women to support his real family.
filmography.plot: A suave but cynical man supports his family by marrying and murdering wealthy women, but the job has some occupational hazards.

filmography.title: Limelight
filmography.role_description: A washed-up vaudeville comedian who saves a suicidal dancer and helps her regain her confidence.
filmography.plot: A fading comedian and a suicidally despondent ballet dancer must look to each other to find meaning and hope in their lives.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Score (Awarded in 1973)

filmography.title: A King in New York
filmography.role_description: An exiled European monarch who comes to New York and gets caught up in the McCarthy-era political witch hunts.
filmography.plot: A deposed European monarch seeks refuge in New York City, where he becomes an accidental television celebrity.
filmography.awards: Cahiers du Cinéma: Top 10 Films of 1957

filmography.title: A Countess from Hong Kong
filmography.role_description: A brief cameo as an old ship steward in his final film, which he also wrote and directed.
filmography.plot: A Russian countess stows away in the stateroom of a wealthy American diplomat.

filmography.title: The Immigrant
filmography.role_description: A penniless immigrant who endures a challenging voyage to America and falls in love.
filmography.plot: The Tramp struggles with the boat ride across the Atlantic and gets into trouble as soon as he arrives in America.

filmography.title: Easy Street
filmography.role_description: A down-and-out tramp who reforms and becomes a policeman to clean up a tough neighborhood.
filmography.plot: A reformed tramp becomes a police constable who must fight a huge thug who dominates an inner-city street.

filmography.title: A Dog's Life
filmography.role_description: A lonely tramp who befriends a stray dog named Scraps, and together they try to survive the city.
filmography.plot: The Tramp and his dog companion struggle to survive in the inner city.

filmography.title: Shoulder Arms
filmography.role_description: A bumbling army recruit who dreams of being a hero in the trenches of World War I.
filmography.plot: Charlie is a boot camp private who has a dream of being a hero who goes on a daring mission behind enemy lines.

filmography.title: The Pilgrim
filmography.role_description: An escaped convict who disguises himself as a minister and is mistaken for the new pastor of a small town.
filmography.plot: An escaped convict disguises himself as a preacher and attempts to hide from the law in a small town.

filmography.title: The Kid Auto Races at Venice
filmography.role_description: A spectator who persistently gets in the way of a camera crew filming a soapbox derby; the first public appearance of the Tramp character.
filmography.plot: Charlie Chaplin's Little Tramp character makes his debut as a spectator at a baby-cart race in Venice, California.

filmography.title: Pay Day
filmography.role_description: A construction worker who tries to keep his hard-earned money from his demanding wife so he can enjoy a night out.
filmography.plot: Chaplin plays a bricklayer who tries to enjoy his pay day night out while hiding money from his wife.

filmography.title: The Idle Class
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing both his classic Tramp character and a wealthy, absent-minded husband.
filmography.plot: The Tramp sneaks into a golf resort and is mistaken for a rich woman's husband.

filmography.title: The Pawnshop
filmography.role_description: A clumsy assistant in a pawnshop who wreaks havoc while trying to do his job.
filmography.plot: Charlie works in a pawnshop where he engages in slapstick battles with his fellow employee and deals with eccentric customers.

filmography.title: The Cure
filmography.role_description: A drunkard who checks into a health spa to dry out but brings a trunk full of alcohol with him.
filmography.plot: An alcoholic checks into a health spa and his antics promptly throw the establishment into chaos.

filmography.title: One A.M.
filmography.role_description: A wealthy drunk who arrives home late and struggles to get upstairs and into bed in a solo performance.
filmography.plot: A drunken man arrives home early in the morning and tries to get to bed, battling inanimate objects along the way.

filmography.title: The Rink
filmography.role_description: An incompetent waiter who spends his lunch break showing off his skills at a roller skating rink.
filmography.plot: After causing chaos at a restaurant, a waiter goes to a roller rink where he meets a girl and creates more havoc.

filmography.title: The Adventurer
filmography.role_description: An escaped convict who saves a drowning woman and her mother, then tries to blend in at their high-society party.
filmography.plot: The Little Tramp escapes from prison and saves a girl and her mother from drowning, then creates havoc at a posh party.

filmography.title: Sunnyside
filmography.role_description: A farm handyman who works for a strict boss and dreams of dancing with nymphs.
filmography.plot: Charlie works on a farm from 4am to late at night, snatching food on the run and loving the neighbor's daughter.

filmography.title: Tillie's Punctured Romance
filmography.role_description: A city slicker and con man who tricks a wealthy country girl into marriage to steal her money.
filmography.plot: A con man from the city tricks a wealthy farm girl into marriage, but complications ensue when his old girlfriend shows up.

filmography.title: The Vagabond
filmography.role_description: A street musician who rescues a girl from a band of gypsies and falls in love with her.
filmography.plot: The Tramp plays the violin to earn money, rescues a girl from gypsies, and finds himself in a love triangle.
